reuze.pending

Class MocapPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • reuze.pending.MocapPlayer

  • public class MocapPlayer
extends Object
    Plays a mocap animation, the "motor" that drives every skeleton. Needs the skeleton and the animation data (usually mocap data). The method update(fps) must be called periodically to make animation run.
    Author:
    Michael Kipp

      void setPinAtRoot(boolean val)
      When set, figure's root will not move at all, the figure is "pinned" at its root joint (usually the hip).
      void setPlaybackFps(float fps)
      Intended playback speed of the motion capture fragment.
      void update(float fps)

      • setPinAtRoot

        public void setPinAtRoot(boolean val)
        When set, figure's root will not move at all, the figure is "pinned" at its root joint (usually the hip).
        Parameters:
        val - whether to pin or not

        public void frameBackward()

      • update

        public void update(float fps)
        Converts the system's fps to the intended playback fps und changes animation frames accordingly. Usually system speed is higher (and is also an upper limit to the playback speed).
        Parameters:
        fps - The fps speed of the system
